SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants to help his young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Let‚Äôs see how he has the conversation with his young son, {F1_SON_5}.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.

text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Wat bedoel jy, {F1_FATHER}?

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Eerstens, ons het almal privaatdele op ons liggame. Dit is die dele wat bedek word deur ons onderklere.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say "no" if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.

text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Oukei, {F1_FATHER}.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or {F1_MOTHER}. We're here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: En as enige iets ooit gebeur wat jou bang of onrustig laat voel, onthou jy kan altyd vir my of {F1_MOTHER} kom vertel. Ons is hier om jou te beskerm en veilig te hou.

text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Ek sal vir jou en {F1_MOTHER} vertel, {F1_FATHER}.

SourceText: This lesson is about learning how to respond when our children are in crisis.‚ùó
text: Hierdie les gaan jou leer hoe om te reageer wanneer jou kind in 'n krisis is. ‚ùó

SourceText: When our children share something that is very hard or upsetting to themüòîüò£, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open, so that they feel supported. üíõ
text: Wanneer ons kinders iets deel wat baie moeilik of ontstellend is vir hulleüòîüò£, moet ons onthou om kalm te bly, te luister en oop te wees, sodat hulle geondersteun kan voel. üíõ

SourceText: True or False: When my child is upset, I should wait for them to come to me. I don‚Äôt want to upset them further by asking what is troubling them.
text: Waar of Vals: Wanneer my kind ontsteld is, moet ek vir hulle wag om na my toe te kom. Ek wil hulle nie verder ontstel deur te vra wat pla hulle nie.

SourceText: üò£ When children are in crisis, they may be scared to tell others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.
text: üò£ Wanneer kinders in krisis is, mag hulle bang wees om vir ander te vertel vir baie redes. Hulle mag bekommerd wees dat ander hulle sal oordeel of sal kwaad word. Hulle mag dalk selfs skaamte voel.

SourceText: üíö You can ask your child very calmly about why they seem upset. üëÄ
text: üíö Jy kan jou kind baie rustig vra hoekom hulle ontsteld lyk. üëÄ

SourceText: üëÇ Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.
text: üëÇVerseker hulle dat jy trots is op hoe dapper hulle is om die krisis met jou te deel.

SourceText: üå∑ That‚Äôs right!
text: üå∑ Dit is reg!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Let‚Äôs see how his father responds:
text: {F1_SON_5} lyk ontsteld. Kom ons kyk hoe sy pa reageer:

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: I don't want to play with Daniel today.
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Ek wil nie vandag met Daniel speel nie.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: What happened, {F1_SON_5}? I thought you and Daniel were friends. Do you want to talk about it?
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Wat het gebeur, {F1_SON_5}? Ek het gedink jy en Daniel is vriende. Wil jy daaroor praat?

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}** (crying): He and some of the other kids were mean to me. They said I was stupid because I can‚Äôt button my shirt properly.
text: **{F1_SON_5}** (huil): Hy en 'n paar van die ander kinders was lelik met my. Hulle het ges√™ ek is dom omdat ek nie my hemp reg kan knoop nie.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}** : Oh my {F1_SON_5}, that is not a very nice thing to say to someone. I can understand why you would feel upset about this.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ag nee {F1_SON_5}, dit is nie 'n baie mooi ding om vir iemand te s√™ nie. Ek kan verstaan hoekom jy ontsteld sal voel oor dit.

SourceText: First of all, you are not stupid! I am so proud of how much you are growing and learning. It is important that Daniel and the others know that it is not okay to say mean things. Would you like me to come with you so that we can have a chat with the others together?
text: Eerste van als, jy is nie dom nie! Ek is so trots oor hoe baie jy groei en leer. Dit is belangrik dat Daniel en die ander weet dat dit nie reg is om lelike goed oor ander te s√™ nie. Wil jy h√™ ek moet saam met jou kom, sodat ons saam met die ander kan praat?

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: Okay‚Ä¶
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Oukei‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: I can also have a chat with Daniel's parents to let them know. Daniel is a good boy and is usually nice to you so maybe there is something else happening.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ek kan ook met Daniel se ouers praat en hulle laat weet wat aangaan. Daniel is 'n goeie seun en is gewoonlik gaaf teenoor jou, so dalk is daar iets anders wat aangaan.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing with me, {F1_SON_5}. I am very proud of you.
text: Dankie dat jy dit met my deel, {F1_SON_5}. Ek is baie trots op jou.

SourceText: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Here are four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you:
text: 4Ô∏è‚É£Hier is vier goed wat jy kan doen om jou kind te ondersteun wanneer hulle iets moeilik met jou deel:

SourceText: 1Ô∏è‚É£ BREATHE: Take a pause
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ HAAL ASEM: Vat 'n blaaskans

SourceText: üå± Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
text: üå±Haal diep asem sodat jy rustig kan reageer.

SourceText: üíõ Ask yourself, ‚ÄúWhat does my child need right now?‚Äù
text: üíõVra jouself, "Wat het my kind nou nodig?"

SourceText: 2Ô∏è‚É£ LISTEN: Ask your child what is going on
text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ LUISTER: Vra jou kind wat aangaan

SourceText: üëÇ Let your child share with you what they need. Sometimes, it may be easier for your child to draw what happened instead of explaining it.
text: üëÇLaat jou kind met jou deel wat hulle nodig het. Soms, is dit makliker vir jou kind om te teken wat gebeur het eerder as om dit te verduidelik.

SourceText: üëÄ Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard.
text: üëÄ Let op na hoe hulle voel en vertel vir hulle wat jy op let sodat hulle weet hulle word gehoor.

SourceText: üíô Tell your child that you are there for them and love them.
text: üíô Vertel vir jou kind jy is daar vir hulle en lief vir hulle.

SourceText: üò£Both girls AND boys could face hard times and crisis situations. Remember to check-in with both.
text: üò£ Beide meisies EN seuns kan moeilike tye en situasies ervaar. Onthou om vir albei te vra hoe dit gaan.

SourceText: 3Ô∏è‚É£ RESPOND: What might help?

SourceText: üî∂ You might need to help your child talk about their feelings.
text: üî∂ Jy mag dalk nodig h√™ om jou kind te help om oor hulle gevoelens te praat.

SourceText: ‚è∏ In the moment, your child needs you to be there for them with love and accept their feelings.
text: ‚è∏ In die oomblik het jou kind jou nodig om daar te wees met liefde en hulle gevoelens te aanvaar.

SourceText: ‚û°Ô∏è You might need to talk about the actions that you or your child could take to help with what has happened.

SourceText: ‚úÖ Remember, you can always type {HELP} to ParentText and get information about resources in your community where you can receive help.

SourceText: 4Ô∏è‚É£ COMFORT: Be there for your child

SourceText: üå∑ It can be hard to see your child feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.
text: üå∑ Dit kan moeilik wees om jou kind ontsteld of verward te sien, maar daar is baie wat jy kan doen om hulle te ondersteun.

SourceText: üíö They need you to accept them and comfort them when difficult things are going on.
text: üíö Hulle het nodig dat jy hulle aanvaar en troos wanneer moeilike dinge aangaan.

SourceText: üîÑIn these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.
text: üîÑIn hierdie oomblikke kan dit besonders nuttig wees om 'n konsekwente roetine te handhaaf. Bekende roetines kan 'n gevoel van sekuriteit en normaliteit bied, wat jou kind help om weer veilig te voel.

SourceText: üéà Remind your child again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.

SourceText: This lesson is about learning how to keep your teens safe in your community. üö©

SourceText: You are not alone! Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs test your knowledge about teen safety.

SourceText: Which of these is a space guaranteed to keep your teen safe?

SourceText: Your teen can face harm anywhere, even at home üè† or church ‚õ™. As parents, it's our job to help them plan üìù to avoid tough situations and handle them if they happen, no matter where they are üåç.

SourceText: üéâYou're right.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs check in on {F1_DAUGHTER_16} and her mom:

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: Something happened when I was out with my friends {FRIEND_FEMALE_1} and {FRIEND_FEMALE_2}!
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: Iets het gebeur toe ek saam met my vriende, {FRIEND_FEMALE_1} en {FRIEND_FEMALE_2} uit was!

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Tell me, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Vertel my, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}

SourceText: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what‚Äôs your name?
text: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Hallo mooiste. Ek kyk nou al 'n rukkie na jou. Jy is baie mooi, wat is jou naam?

SourceText: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: Her name is {F1_DAUGHTER_16}
text: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: Haar naam is {F1_DAUGHTER_16}

SourceText: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16}, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you‚Äôll be back in time, I promise‚Ä¶
text: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16}, wil jy saam met my ietsie kom drink en skyfies eet? Kom aan, klim in, jy sal betyds terug wees, ek belowe‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs a good idea‚Ä¶
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: Ek is nie seker of dit 'n goeie idee is nie‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I‚Äôm telling you, if you don‚Äôt do this I‚Äôm going to tell everyone you are stupid!
text: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_1}**: Jy is gelukkig, vriendin. Ek wens ‚Äôn man wil MY uitvra en vir my geskenke koop. Ek s√™ jou, as jy dit nie doen nie, gaan ek vir almal vertel dat jy dom is!

SourceText: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_2}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16} don‚Äôt go! Be careful! Let‚Äôs go home. It is dangerous to go with people you don‚Äôt know. Besides, he‚Äôs too old for you and what he is doing is wrong.
text: **{FRIEND_FEMALE_2}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_16} moenie gaan nie! Wees versigtig! Kom ons gaan huis toe. Dit is gevaarlik om saam met mense te gaan wat jy nie ken nie. Buitendien, hy is te oud vir jou en wat hy doen, is verkeerd.

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: I just don‚Äôt know‚Ä¶
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: Ek weet net nie‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Pfff, ek is so trots op jou dat jy nie in die motor geklim het nie. Dit was ‚Äôn gevaarlike situasie, dankie dat jy my vertel het!

SourceText: One way to keep your teen safe is to create a safety map with them. Together, identify the safe and unsafe places in your community. üìñ

SourceText: To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in.

SourceText: Check out these scenarios. What warning signs do you see?

SourceText: Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ùå. If you're attacked, it‚Äôs never your fault. Do what you need to stay safe and get away ‚Äîdon't worry about what others think. You are worth defending üí™. You are strong and powerful ‚ö°.

SourceText: If someone makes you or anyone else feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, it‚Äôs never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home üè†. Trust your gut. If you feel attacked by words or actions, your goal is to get away.

SourceText: Your voice can stop many attacks.

SourceText: Be clear, confident, and direct. Use your voice, body language, and eye contact. If you don't feel safe, you can do whatever it takes to get away.

SourceText: Using your voice can look different in different situations. You could shout "No!", call for help, act strangely to confuse the attacker, or negotiate.
